message: When I was a corrections officer we had the same rules....it could not touch your collar and men could not have ponytails..... Its a dresscode and its in place. They have the right to enforce it
Unfortunately it's everywhere!
Much more necessary than the travel ban last week

Oh how I wish you would come to my house. You would be the perfect team for my husband and me. I think you two are great. I just told my husband the other night, that I liked you guys the best. You bring the best of two worlds together and are so down to earth and comfortable to watch because I feel like I am right there. NO ONE, not even the President has a right to do this to you. It's happening way to much and we need to fight back. Hang in there, you have a """"LOT"""" of folks rooting for you.

""""normal kids."""" That's just insulting. By giving transgender kids their own bathroom puts them in a spotlight and tells them and everyone around them that they aren't normal. This would put a target on their back. Most transgender kids who are out enough to want to use the bathroom of the gender they identify have probably been through years of therapy and possibly been living as that gender for years. They probably dress like said gender and may be on hormone blockers. There wouldn't be anything awkward about it, especially in a bathroom where there are STALLS. No one would even notice. I've used the men's bathroom for over 3 years now, and guess what, no one even looks twice. This is not an issue.
